channel.title: Comments on: Molten Baby Cakes – Soft centered Chocolate Puddings

item.title: By: Gweni
item.dc:creator: Gweni
item.description: Brilliant, so easy .. I cooked them longer almost 20 mins for my children and still delicious.
item.content:encoded: Brilliant, so easy .. I cooked them longer almost 20 mins for my children and still delicious.

item.title: By: grace
item.dc:creator: grace
item.description: melty, gooey chocolate gets me every time. yes, these may be mini, but that just means i can eat two and not feel so guilty. :)
item.content:encoded: melty, gooey chocolate gets me every time. yes, these may be mini, but that just means i can eat two and not feel so guilty. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Missy
item.dc:creator: Missy
item.description: this is so lovely!!! good that you are sharing
item.content:encoded: this is so lovely!!! good that you are sharing

item.title: By: Y
item.dc:creator: Y
item.description: That looks fantastic, and who doesn't love a molten choc pudding, I ask ya!
item.content:encoded: That looks fantastic, and who doesn’t love a molten choc pudding, I ask ya!

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/molten-baby-cakes-soft-centered-chocolate-puddings/comment-page-1/#comment-36">Arwen from Hoglet K</a>.
Hi Arwen As there is baking paper on the bottom of the ramekins, all you need to do is slice a knife around the edge, put a plate on top of them and turn it over. They should come out fine - unless, like me, you under-cook them, in which case they will definitely fall apart :) .
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Arwen from Hoglet K.

Hi Arwen
As there is baking paper on the bottom of the ramekins, all you need to do is slice a knife around the edge, put a plate on top of them and turn it over. They should come out fine – unless, like me, you under-cook them, in which case they will definitely fall apart ðŸ™‚ .

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/molten-baby-cakes-soft-centered-chocolate-puddings/comment-page-1/#comment-34">Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella</a>.
I have made the recipe four or more times now, and only once have half the cakes turned out cooked to perfection. I often have to cook for minute or two longer than the recipe states, but I often forget to and they turn out like liquid chocolate - although I don't hear many complaints :P .
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella.

I have made the recipe four or more times now, and only once have half the cakes turned out cooked to perfection. I often have to cook for minute or two longer than the recipe states, but I often forget to and they turn out like liquid chocolate – although I don’t hear many complaints ðŸ˜› .

item.title: By: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.dc:creator: Arwen from Hoglet K
item.description: Wow, the molten chocolate looks beautiful. It must be so difficult to get them out of the ramekin without breaking them.
item.content:encoded: Wow, the molten chocolate looks beautiful. It must be so difficult to get them out of the ramekin without breaking them.

item.title: By: Renee
item.dc:creator: Renee
item.description: they look wonderful Anita - I am going to have to try them!
item.content:encoded: they look wonderful Anita – I am going to have to try them!

item.title: By: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.dc:creator: Lorraine @NotQuiteNigella
item.description: Well done! have to admit I've never been able to get that recipe to work for me. It never ends up cooked enough although I haven't tried it for years so maybe a revisit is in order :)
item.content:encoded: Well done! have to admit I’ve never been able to get that recipe to work for me. It never ends up cooked enough although I haven’t tried it for years so maybe a revisit is in order ðŸ™‚
